bill_title: limit the amount of a supersedeas bond that must be posted to stay the execution of a judgment while an appeal is pending.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the amount of a supersedeas bond that must be posted to stay the execution of a judgment while an appeal is pending. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 15-26A-26 be amended to read as follows: 15-26A-26. If the appeal is from a judgment directing the payment of money, the conditions of the bond required by § 15-26A-25 shall be the payment of the judgment or that part of the judgment which is affirmed together with interest thereon from the date of the judgment. The amount of the bond may not exceed twenty-five million dollars regardless of the amount of judgment. However, if an appellee proves by a preponderance of the evidence that an appellant is dissipating assets outside the ordinary course of business to avoid payment of a judgment, the court may require the appellant to execute a bond in the amount of the judgment. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
